On Oct 2, 2006, at 4:15 AM, Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Roy T. Fielding wrote:
>
> > Well, so do I. Self-descriptive means that the type is registered  
> and
> > the registry points to a specification and the specification  
> explains
> > how to process the data according to its intent.
>
> Data doesn't have intent.

I meant the sender's intent, of course.

I explained it more concretely for the more concrete subject of
the web architecture:

    http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/doc/mime-respect.html

....Roy
